main event: An unidentified saucer-shaped luminous object was observed traveling at high speed in Bethesda, Maryland on February 10, 1955.
interesting points: The object emitted a sound described as 'a mellow motor or engine sound.',The object was described as having a flat top and a spherical bottom.,The object changed colors from yellow to blue-green to amber to orange.,The sighting included a formation of stationary scintillating luminous objects for 30 seconds.,The witness briefly observed the object descend and diminish in size.
witness description: A colonel employed as an aircraft observer for the Industrial Division, Diamond Ordnance Fuze Laboratories.
